summary: This document is an FBI 302 interview summary of Juan Alessi, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, conducted by Assistant U.S. Attorneys and a Special Agent/Detective. Alessi reviews a seized message book from Epstein's Palm Beach residence, identifies handwriting, and provides new recollections about Epstein's activities, staff, and visitors, including Ghislaine Maxwell's role and the presence of notable figures.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.role: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, witness
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who is reviewing a seized message book and providing testimony about his employment, including observations about Epstein's activities, staff, and visitors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE, the employer of Juan Alessi and the central figure in the case. Alessi discusses his properties, plane, and interactions with girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as GM. Alessi recalls seeing her crying, her instructions to staff, her role in managing massage supplies, and her interactions with visitors.

persons.name: Sen. Edward Kennedy
persons.context: Recalled by Juan Alessi as having visited Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

persons.name: General Wesley Clark
persons.context: Recalled by Juan Alessi as having visited Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

persons.name: Francis
persons.context: Recalled by Juan Alessi as a girlfriend Epstein dated in the 1990s, around the same time as Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Alessi was an employee of Jeffrey Epstein, responsible for taking messages and other household duties.
Alessi received instructions from Maxwell, such as when to buy massage supplies, and had personal conversations with her.
Maxwell was present at Epstein's residence, managed aspects of his household, and was observed by Alessi in an emotional state related to Epstein's behavior with other girls.
Senator Edward Kennedy was a visitor to Epstein's Palm Beach residence, as recalled by Alessi.
General Wesley Clark was a visitor to Epstein's Palm Beach residence, as recalled by Alessi.
Francis was recalled by Alessi as a girlfriend Epstein dated in the 1990s.

events.title: Message Book Seizure Review
events.description: Juan Alessi reviews a message book seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence office, with entries dating back to 2002, and identifies handwriting.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Crying Incident
events.description: Juan Alessi recalls driving Ghislaine Maxwell while she was crying in the back of a car. When he asked why she put up with Epstein 'messing with all these other girls,' she responded 'I cannot leave.'

events.title: First Meeting with Victim
events.description: Juan Alessi estimates he first met a female individual (whose name is redacted but implied to be a victim) around 1996 or 1997, and recalls an incident where her boyfriend was not allowed inside Epstein's house.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence (PB residence)
keyFacts: A seized message book from Epstein's Palm Beach residence, used by employees to log phone calls, was reviewed by former employee Juan Alessi, who identified his and his wife's handwriting on messages dating back to 2002.

Juan Alessi provided a significant new recollection: he witnessed Ghislaine Maxwell crying in a car in the 1990s and, when he asked why she put up with Epstein 'messing with all these other girls,' she stated, 'I cannot leave.'
Alessi recalled that Senator Edward Kennedy and General Wesley Clark visited Epstein's Palm Beach residence.
Alessi stated that Ghislaine Maxwell instructed him on when to buy supplies for massages for Jeffrey Epstein.
The document indicates the interview was conducted to prepare for trial testimony, and Alessi provided previously undisclosed or clarifying recollections.
